field.label: Override API specification
field.helpText: Checking this box will allow you to supply a URL for an updated OAS3 specification.

field.label: URL of OAS3 Specification
field.helpText: This will override the custom specification included with the connector.

field.label: Authentication Type
field.helpText: Identifies the authentication type for the connection. <boomi-help id="ATOMSPHERE:9BB88920-7DB1-45EA-B650-F9C1244C24E2">Learn more</boomi-help> about authentication.

scope.helpText:
Defines the extent and access range to protected cloud resources. When using the JWT Bearer Token grant type, leave this field blank. The scope must be set as an extended JWT claim.

When using the Authorization Code grant type, enter any applicable scopes and verify that each entry is separated by a space.

See applicable scopes here: https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/scopes

grantType.helpText:
Grant type refers to the way an application gets an OAuth 2.0 access token for client authentication to protected cloud resources.

Authorization Code is the standard, 3-Legged OAuth 2.0 authorization where you grant the client an authorization code that can be exchanged for an access token.

With JWT Bearer Token, the user provides claim information to generate an assertion, and the assertion is sent to the server to get the access token.

issuer.helpText: Identifies the principal that creates, signs, and issues the claim to access the cloud resources. You can enter either the Email or Unique ID from the Google Cloud Platform console (Service account details page).

subject.helpText: Identifies the principal that is the subject of the claim to access the cloud resources. Optionally enter either the Email or Unique ID from the Google Cloud Platform console (Service account details page).

signatureKey.helpText: Identifies the private key that is used to sign the JWT and allow access to the cloud resources. You create the key in the Google Cloud Platform console using the P12 key type (Service account details page, Key ID field) and then import the certificate into Boomi Integration.
